title: Crash - Failed to store last header's hash
body:
#### System information
Geth version: 1.8.8-stable
OS & Version: Linux Mint 18.3
Git Commit: 2688dab48c9b8ae71b8d95c7678817eaa17f2b53
Architecture: amd64
Protocol Versions: [63 62]
Network Id: 1
Go Version: go1.10
Operating System: linux
GOPATH=
GOROOT=/usr/lib/go-1.10

#### Expected behaviour
sync blockchain

#### Actual behaviour
crash

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
fresh start , no chaindata , fast mode
```
$ geth --syncmode "fast" --bootnodesv4 "enode://81b95b9bc444563d3defb4cf3b1e66308d8ce9f2e072562325f596c82a03f1d349e57dfe93736afacac4428fe9b55b8a3ce6b9b19a1ec70d34aab21931d31178@192.168.1.110:30303"
INFO [05-22|20:50:16] Maximum peer count                       ETH=25 LES=0 total=25
INFO [05-22|20:50:16] Starting peer-to-peer node               instance=Geth/v1.8.8-stable-2688dab4/linux-amd64/go1.10
INFO [05-22|20:50:16] Allocated cache and file handles         database=/home/sum/.ethereum/geth/chaindata cache=768 handles=512
INFO [05-22|20:50:16] Writing default main-net genesis block 
INFO [05-22|20:50:22] Persisted trie from memory database      nodes=12356 size=2.34mB time=574.057327ms gcnodes=0 gcsize=0.00B gctime=0s livenodes=1 livesize=0.00B
INFO [05-22|20:50:22] Initialised chain configuration          config="{ChainID: 1 Homestead: 1150000 DAO: 1920000 DAOSupport: true EIP150: 2463000 EIP155: 2675000 EIP158: 2675000 Byzantium: 4370000 Constantinople: <nil> Engine: ethash}"
INFO [05-22|20:50:22] Disk storage enabled for ethash caches   dir=/home/sum/.ethereum/geth/ethash count=3
INFO [05-22|20:50:22] Disk storage enabled for ethash DAGs     dir=/home/sum/.ethash               count=2
INFO [05-22|20:50:22] Initialising Ethereum protocol           versions="[63 62]" network=1
INFO [05-22|20:50:22] Loaded most recent local header          number=0 hash=d4e567…cb8fa3 td=17179869184
INFO [05-22|20:50:22] Loaded most recent local full block      number=0 hash=d4e567…cb8fa3 td=17179869184
INFO [05-22|20:50:22] Loaded most recent local fast block      number=0 hash=d4e567…cb8fa3 td=17179869184
INFO [05-22|20:50:22] Loaded local transaction journal         transactions=0 dropped=0
INFO [05-22|20:50:22] Regenerated local transaction journal    transactions=0 accounts=0
INFO [05-22|20:50:22] Starting P2P networking 
INFO [05-22|20:50:24] UDP listener up                          self=enode://81b95b9bc444563d3defb4cf3b1e66308d8ce9f2e072562325f596c82a03f1d349e57dfe93736afacac4428fe9b55b8a3ce6b9b19a1ec70d34aab21931d31178@[::]:30303
INFO [05-22|20:50:24] RLPx listener up                         self=enode://81b95b9bc444563d3defb4cf3b1e66308d8ce9f2e072562325f596c82a03f1d349e57dfe93736afacac4428fe9b55b8a3ce6b9b19a1ec70d34aab21931d31178@[::]:30303
INFO [05-22|20:50:24] IPC endpoint opened                      url=/home/sum/.ethereum/geth.ipc
INFO [05-22|20:50:44] Block synchronisation started 
WARN [05-22|20:50:46] Node data write error                    err="state node 210462…31a821 failed with all peers (1 tries, 1 peers)"
WARN [05-22|20:50:46] Synchronisation failed, retrying         err="state node 210462…31a821 failed with all peers (1 tries, 1 peers)"
WARN [05-22|20:51:01] Synchronisation failed, retrying         err="block download canceled (requested)"
INFO [05-22|20:51:10] Generating ethash verification cache     epoch=0 percentage=28 elapsed=3.002s
INFO [05-22|20:51:10] Imported new state entries               count=1350 elapsed=1.135ms processed=1350 pending=15532 retry=2 duplicate=0 unexpected=0
INFO [05-22|20:51:13] Imported new state entries  ...
...
INFO [05-23|11:55:00] Imported new block receipts              count=48   elapsed=360.693ms  number=5466395 hash=14e48d…1f391a size=4.37mB   ignored=0
CRIT [05-23|11:55:04] Failed to store last header's hash       err="leveldb/table: corruption on data-block (pos=390645): checksum mismatch, want=0x39643aec got=0x4ba2f24b [file=271273.ldb]"
```

#### Backtrace

````
[backtrace]
````
Either your machine crashed hard and corrupted your database, or you have bad sectors on your drive.

- machine did not crash, all other processes were fine
- I have a pretty new Samsung SSD, although that would not rule out that it has a problem with a sector - I will check

Extended self-test examines complete disk surface and performs various test routines built into the drive. Its result is reported in the Self-test Log.
RESULT : OK - NO ERRORS

Should geth not at least start to try to recover when I restart it? It looks like as if it has (now) not a database problem, but a peer connection problem. I now get a lot of these messages
WARN [05-23|18:22:39] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer ...
```
sum@zotac:~$ geth --syncmode "fast"
```

same thing just happened to me   

INFO [06-04|19:26:41] Imported new state entries               count=326  elapsed=8m42.172s processed=34880552 pending=53868  retry=91  duplicate=660 unexpected=3274
ERROR[06-04|19:26:41] Dangling trie nodes after full cleanup

no idea if it helps you, but worked for me
 - delete that .ldb causing error
 - run "geth upgradedb"

As I've mentioned, this is a disk corruption. Closing as it's caused by a faulty hard drive.

PS: Never delete a random database file.
Why issue is closed? Where instructions for same cases?

How to fix, I have the same error in 1.8.27 and in 1.9.2

INFO [07-25|07:16:48.351] Initialising Ethereum protocol           versions=[63] network=1 dbversion=7
CRIT [07-25|07:16:48.587] Failed to store last header's hash       err="leveldb/table: corruption on data-block (pos=295739): checksum mismatch, want=0x18813221 got=0xc15f84ed [file=9254600.ldb]"
